paragraphs: Envelope of Abraham Lincoln to Enos & Ridgely, [14 June 1848]1
citations: U.S. HouseJournal. 1847. 30th Cong., 1st sess., 1, 7; U.S. HouseJournal. 1849. 30th Cong., 2nd sess., 672-73.

footnotes.text:
1Abraham Lincoln addressed the envelope, and he also wrote and signed the free postage
                  frank. Lincoln served in theU.S. House of Representativesfrom December 6, 1847 to March 3, 1849.  The envelope is postmarked June 14, and
                  1848 was the only year during which Lincoln served inCongressin June. The envelopeâ€™s contents have not been located.U.S. HouseJournal. 1847. 30th Cong., 1st sess., 1, 7; U.S. HouseJournal. 1849. 30th Cong., 2nd sess., 672-73.
